Three terms related to employment types are full-time employees, part-time or casual workers and contract employees.

full-time employees

Full-time employees are considered "normal" or " routine" employees who come to work at their regular hours, on a regular schedule. Some of the job-specific training, such as advancements in technology or job-related knowledge, may require an individual to work less hours per week. Full-time employees have a regular salary and benefits.

part-time or casual workers

Part-time or casual workers come from various industries and job backgrounds, and some have a flexible schedule, while others work on a project-by-project basis or a set schedule. In the case of caring for someone, the worker typically works flexible hours to provide care and support.

contract employees
